result.execSummary:
The defendant George Alton Ridyard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. George Alton Ridyard is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • George Alton Ridyard was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

01:36 PM- IN CUSTODY 

Defendant George Alton Ridyard in court with attorney Amy M Johnson. Prosecuting Atty Rebekah M Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin. Hearing regarding PTS Violations. ADA Rennicke's position on bail. States victim would like the bond to allow contact. Atty Johnson's position on bail. DE would like contact with DE. CT: Atty Johnson to go talk with ADA Demarco to see if resolution can be reached. ADA Demarco unable to attend today/Friday's hearing. CT states someone with authority to make an offer needs to appear at the STC scheduled on 7/29 or CT will consider dismissing case. CT: reinstates current cash bail and increases bail by $100 per case w/ referral to DCPS. Condition of "Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Sandra D." modified to "No acts or threats of violence towards Sandra D." All other conditions to remain the same. DE to comply with PTS. DE's appearance waived at 7/29/22 Hearing but needs to be available by phone so his atty can contact him.
